title: Breaking News: Broken Window
body: One of the windows at our new space got itself good and busted in late last night. When I received the phone call this morning, I immediately assumed the worst - the speakers were stolen, our tools were gone, the cinebar had been demolished, my sunflower seeds were dashed across the floor - but luckily that wasn't the case. As soon as I saw the window, I knew no one had gone through it. Check it out: My next thought was vandalism. I searched around for a brick or rock or anything that could've been thrown through the glass, but there was nothing to be found. As I continued to look at the pattern of the broken window, a probable scenario played out in my head. Since the area of stress on the glass was about back/shoulder height, it leads me to believe that someone either fell on or was pushed into the glass, causing it to crack and shatter. The pane itself had a point of weakness where it had been hit by a small rock, and was loose within the frame, so it wouldn't have taken much to create enough stress to shatter the glass. We were lucky that nothing was taken, and I'm not taking this stroke of luck for granted. Our alarm system was installed this weekend, but we hadn't activated it yet due to all the workers who were still coming and going at all hours of the day. Also, we hadn't turned on our insurance at the new place either. We remedied both of those oversights today. Now everything's as snug as a bug in a rug, and we'll soon be getting a new piece of tempered glass to replace the 50-year-old piece that was broken. In relation to the window incident, everything else that's happened over the last few days pales in comparison. Our plumbing fixtures are in, but not working yet. Our chandeliers will be hung tomorrow or the next day. The Cinebar is shimmed and level. The granite countertops have been measured and templated. The floors in the auditoriums are cleaned and sealed. Phew. That makes me tired just writing that stuff out. More later.
author: Dan
